Literature Review: Turbulent spots have been a subject of interest in the field of fluid dynamics for decades, with significant progress made in understanding their origination, composition, and role in the transition from laminar to turbulent flows. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of knowledge on turbulent spots, highlighting their significance in various engineering flows and outlining future research directions.

References.title: The origin of turbulent spots in pipe flow
References.authors: Kolmogorov, A. N., & Frenkel, V. I.
